result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven R. Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven R. Butler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven R. Butler was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The fine and costs are to be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Court at the rate of $100.00 a month beginning June 1, 2022.    Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days and preapproved by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven R. Butler

defendant.name: Butler, Steven R.
defendant.address: N7295 Wellington Lake Road, Rib Lake, WI 54470

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

09:04 AM Defendant Steven R. Butler in court with attorney Gerald J. Hersil.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Victim notification has been complied.  Plea agreement put into the case. Plea of  no contest to count 2 -  misd battery no domestic abuse enhancer.    Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 2 battery.  Court dismisses counts 1 and 3.  Statement by Attorney Fuhr.  Statement by Attorney Hersil.  No statement by defendant.  Court orders a withheld sentence and placement on probation for one year with conditions of $300.00 fine inclusive of costs; DNA sample and surcharge; 50 hours of community service; letter of apology due to the victim within 30 days and preapproved by probation. The fine and costs shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 a month beginning June 1, 2022. - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
Status hearing on May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:30 PM Defendant Steven R. Butler in court with attorney Gerald J. Hersil.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied.   Waived further reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily.   Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Status hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am. - rt

Victim and Order to Remove No Contact From Defendant's Bond

Initial Appearance set for March 15, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.

11:30 AM - Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven R. Butler appeared in person, in custody.  Attorney Tlusty's office attempted to make contact with the victim.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $3,000.00 signature bond; booking; no contact with M.D.Q. - dob:  11-26-03.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney and notice was given to defendant.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 1:30 pm.  - rt
